Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
NOT
<logic> The {Boolean} function which is true only if its input is false. Its {truth table} is:
A | NOT A --+---------- F | T T | F
(1996-11-04)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Not \Not\, adv. [OE. not, noht, nought, naught, the same word as E. naught. See {Naught}.] A word used to express negation, prohibition, denial, or refusal. [1913 Webster]
Not one word spake he more than was need. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
Thou shalt not steal. --Ex. xx. 15. [1913 Webster]
Thine eyes are upon me, and I am not. --Job vii. 8. [1913 Webster]
The question is, may I do it, or may I not do it? --Bp. Sanderson. [1913 Webster]
{Not . . . but}, or {Not but}, only. [Obs. or Colloq.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Not \Not\ [Contr. from ne wot. See 2d {Note}.] Wot not; know not; knows not. [Obs.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Not \Not\, a. Shorn; shaven. [Obs.] See {Nott}. [1913 Webster]
not adv : negation of a word or group of words; "he does not speak French"; "she is not going"; "they are not friends"; "not many"; "not much"; "not at all"
